original_title: CEB, CPC, RDA, & SriLankan in SOE strategy program
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); Sri Lankan authorities and the International Monetary Fund have looked at four separate State-Owned Enterprises in the country for the purpose of putting SOEs on a sustainable footing.
Sarwat Jahan, the IMF Resident Representative in Sri Lanka told reporters on Wednesday (13) that putting public finances on a sustainable footing is a very important part of the IMF program.

She said that in the spirit of putting SOEs on a sustainable footing, one of the structural benchmarks was for the authorities to come up with a strategy for the rebalancing of the SOEs balance sheet.
"Here we have looked at four SOEs, SriLankan Airlines, Ceylon Petroleum Corporation, Ceylon Electricity Board and the Road Development Authority," she announced.

Going forward, SOEs will continue to play an important role in public finances, she noted while adding that , in terms of divesting SOEs the IMF looked into other development partners to work with the authorities.
"On SriLankan Airlines, IFC is working with the authorities, and for CEB, ADB is playing an important role," she said.
